quizzes.title: Ancient Indian Knowledge
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of ancient Indian scriptures, philosophy, and wisdom

questions.question: Who wrote the Arthashastra?
questions.explanation: Arthashastra was written by Chanakya, also known as Kautilya, during the Mauryan period. It covers statecraft, economic policy, and military strategy.

questions.question: Which is the oldest Veda?
questions.explanation: The Rigveda is the oldest of the four Vedas, containing 1,028 hymns dedicated to various deities, composed around 1500-1200 BCE.

questions.question: The Bhagavad Gita is part of the Mahabharata.
questions.explanation: The Bhagavad Gita is a 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the epic Mahabharata, set as a conversation between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna.

questions.question: What does 'Tat Tvam Asi' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Tat Tvam Asi' is one of the Mahavakyas (great sayings) from the Chandogya Upanishad, expressing the unity of the individual soul with the universal consciousness.

questions.question: Which scripture says 'Truth is one; the wise call it by many names'?
questions.explanation: This profound verse (Rigveda 1.164.46) expresses the concept of universal truth being expressed through different paths and names.

quizzes.title: Modern Indian Thinkers
quizzes.description: Explore the wisdom of modern Indian philosophers and leaders

questions.question: Who said 'Arise, awake, and stop not until the goal is reached'?
questions.explanation: This famous quote by Swami Vivekananda emphasizes determination, self-empowerment, and the relentless pursuit of one's goals.

questions.question: Rabindranath Tagore won the Nobel Prize for which work?
questions.explanation: Tagore was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1913 for Gitanjali, a collection of devotional poems.

questions.question: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam was known as the 'Missile Man of India'.
questions.explanation: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam earned this title for his work on the development of ballistic missile and launch vehicle technology in India.

questions.question: Which modern thinker introduced Vedanta philosophy to the Western world?
questions.explanation: Swami Vivekananda's speech at the Parliament of the World's Religions in Chicago (1893) introduced Vedanta and Yoga to the West.

quizzes.title: Indian Scientific Heritage
quizzes.description: Discover the contributions of ancient Indian scientists and mathematicians

questions.question: Who is credited with the concept of zero?
questions.explanation: Brahmagupta was the first to formulate rules for arithmetic involving zero and negative numbers in his work Brahmasphutasiddhanta (628 CE).

questions.question: Sushruta is known as the father of which medical field?
questions.explanation: Sushruta, author of the Sushruta Samhita, is considered the father of surgery for his pioneering work in plastic surgery and surgical techniques.

questions.question: Aryabhata proposed that the Earth rotates on its axis.
questions.explanation: Aryabhata (476-550 CE) was the first to propose that the Earth rotates on its axis daily, centuries before this was accepted in Europe.

questions.question: Who wrote the astronomical text 'Siddhanta Shiromani'?
questions.explanation: Bhaskara II (1114-1185 CE) wrote Siddhanta Shiromani, a comprehensive astronomical work covering mathematics, astronomy, and spherical trigonometry.

questions.question: The ancient Indian system of medicine is called:
questions.explanation: Ayurveda, meaning 'science of life', is an ancient Indian system of medicine dating back over 3,000 years, based on balancing bodily energies.

quizzes.title: Daily Knowledge Challenge
quizzes.description: Random questions from all categories - test your comprehensive knowledge

questions.question: What is the main theme of the Bhagavad Gita?
questions.explanation: The Bhagavad Gita primarily teaches about dharma (duty), karma (action), and the path to self-realization through righteous living.

questions.question: Which poet wrote 'Where the mind is without fear'?
questions.explanation: This famous line is from Tagore's poem in Gitanjali, expressing his vision for an independent and enlightened India.

questions.question: Charaka is known for contributions to ancient Indian surgery.
questions.explanation: Charaka is known for the Charaka Samhita, a foundational text of Ayurveda focusing on internal medicine. Sushruta is known for surgery.

questions.question: The number system we use today originated in:
questions.explanation: The decimal number system (including zero) and Arabic numerals originated in ancient India and were transmitted to the Arab world and then to Europe.

questions.question: Which Upanishad contains the teaching 'Tat Tvam Asi'?
questions.explanation: The Chandogya Upanishad contains this great saying (Mahavakya) taught by sage Uddalaka to his son Svetaketu.
